metadata.title: CVE-2022-1199 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows an attacker to crashthe Linux kernel by simulating amateur radio from the user space, resultingin a null-ptr-deref vulnerability and a use-after-free vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1199` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-lowlatency - 4.4.0-234.268
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-189-generic - 4.15.0-189.200~16.04.1
